translation: The last one who sees the world as unsurpassed will no longer see the venerable in the three realms from now on.

translation: They brought various kinds of good fragrant flowers and various kinds of music to the monks and nuns' monastery in the king's park.

translation: The Buddha's mother parinirvāṇa and the five hundred bhikṣus and nuns are all arhats with great supernormal abilities, whose merits have been fulfilled, so they should be well buried.

source_sentence: 佛勸眾披羅門迦羅越如是。」
translation: The Buddha encourages the śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas to be like this.

source_sentence: 惟舍利國披羅門迦羅越，即便擗地告賢者阿難：「我人有何等過於比丘尼？
translation: The country of Śāriputra, however, was surpassed by the other monks and nuns.

source_sentence: 比丘尼有何恨我人輩？
translation: What's wrong with the monks and nuns who hate us as a group?

source_sentence: 持何等失比丘尼意，般泥洹不告我人？
translation: What's the point of losing the bhikṣuṇī's intention to parinirvāṇa without telling me?

translation: Good man, Ānanda!

translation: From now on, all the rows of seats will be empty. All the streets and lanes in the four corners of the roads will be empty, but only the country of Śāriputra will think it to be empty.

source_sentence: 從今以後，終不復見比丘尼入惟舍利國行分越。」
translation: From now on, he'll never again see a monk or nun enter the country of Vaiśālī and transgress it.

source_sentence: 是時，賢者阿難告惟舍利國披羅門迦羅越：「佛先自說，一切恩愛皆當別離消散，
translation: Then the venerable Ānanda said to the brahman Kālāmaṇḍavyūha of Vaiśālī, “Buddha, let us first explain that all affection and affection should be separated and dispersed.

source_sentence: 各自異處各自異行，所生所至所想，各自有行，各自有因緣，會當別離，

source_sentence: 欲令不別離終不可得，慧人但當護法行。」
translation: If you want to prevent them from being separated, they'll never be obtained, but the wise person will simply guard the practice of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 是時，賢者阿難，為惟舍利國披羅門迦羅越，引若干經要持解披羅門迦羅越意，
translation: At that time, the venerable Ānanda had made a pilgrimage to Vaiśālī in order to explain the meaning of this pilgrimage by citing the essentials of various scriptures.

source_sentence: 喜披羅門迦羅越意，勸披羅門迦羅越意，已解已喜已勸，賢者阿難，便起坐到佛所。

translation: Yadakaravasa and five hundred other brāhmaṇas, carrying five hundred carriages, five hundred jars of hemp oil, five hundred units of firewood, and five hundred units of incense.

translation: Yadakarao Yue then addressed one person, saying, Come up, put a man on your shoulders and cross over the wall into the garden to open the doors.

source_sentence: 是人受迦羅越言，上一人肩上度垣牆即開門。
translation: That person receives the words of Kālôdayin, and one person above him crosses over the wall on his shoulders and opens the door.

source_sentence: 耶游陀迦羅越及五百披羅門，俱入王園比丘尼精舍。
translation: Yaśodharākara and the five hundred brāhmaṇas all entered the monks' and nuns' monastery in the king's park.

source_sentence: 是時五百比丘尼共有六沙彌利，是六沙彌利告耶游陀迦羅越言：「賢者迦羅越！
translation: The five hundred bhikṣus and nuns then had six novices in common, and these six novices addressed Yaśodharā Kālāvatī, saying, Good man, Kālāvatī!

source_sentence: 莫得嬈是五百比丘尼也。
translation: Don't disturb these five hundred bhikṣuṇīs.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 皆是已得定意坐者。」
translation: They're all those who have attained concentration and are sitting in meditation.

source_sentence: 是時，迦羅越告六沙彌利言：「是五百比丘尼，不為定意生，已捨壽命行取泥洹。」
translation: Kālôdayin then addressed the six śrāmaṇerīs, saying, These five hundred monks and nuns who aren't born with a concentrated mind have abandoned their life and practice to enter nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 是時，六沙彌利聞是語即惛擗地言：「誰當復教誡我人者耶？
translation: When the six śrāmaṇeras heard these words, they bowed to the ground and said, Who will again admonish me?

source_sentence: 誰當復諫數我人，當持衣鉢隨誰後耶？」
translation: Who will again remonstrate with me, and who will follow me with my robes and bowl?

source_sentence: 是時，迦羅越告賢者六沙彌利言：「佛先自說，一切恩愛皆當別離。
translation: Kālôdayin then addressed the six śrāmaṇerīs, Good men, saying, The Buddha first said to himself, All kindnesses and loves will be parted.

source_sentence: 賢者沙彌利莫愁憂，但當勤行增精進。」
translation: Good man, śrāmaṇerīs, don't be sad; simply diligently practice and increase your effort.

source_sentence: 是時，迦羅越取摩訶卑耶和題俱曇彌舍利，持若干種香花妓樂，恭敬撿取舍利著金床上，
translation: Kālôdayin then took the Mahāprajñāpāramitā-sāriputra and, carrying various kinds of incense, flowers, and music, respectfully collected it and placed it on a golden bed.

source_sentence: 并五百比丘尼舍利亦如是，便耶游陀迦羅越，并五百披羅門迦羅越，俱取摩訶卑耶和題俱曇彌，
translation: So it was with the five hundred bhikṣus and nuns, who were also like this. Then [the Buddha] went on to pay their respects to Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, together with the five hundred brāhmaṇas; they all

source_sentence: 并五百比丘尼舍利到佛所。
translation: He accompanied the five hundred bhikṣus and nuns to the Buddha’s place.

source_sentence: 是時，佛告賢者舍利弗羅：「汝來！
translation: The Buddha then addressed the good man Śāriputra, Come!

source_sentence: 正東向叉手，下右膝著地，說如是：『有在東方直信者直業者，三神六智大神足功德已滿者，
translation: He bowed his palms to the east, knelt with his right knee touching the ground, and said thus: Someone in the east who directly believes is engaged in straightforward practice. He has fulfilled the virtues of the

source_sentence: 皆來到是間。
translation: They all came to this place.

translation: Why is that?

translation: I'll bury him well together.'

source_sentence: 南方亦爾西方亦爾，北方亦爾，東方亦爾。」
translation: So it is in the south, so it is in the west, so it is in the north, and so it is in the east.

source_sentence: 賢者舍利弗羅受語，即東向、南向、西向、北向請諸阿羅漢。
translation: Good man Śāriputra accepted the invitation and invited the arhats to face east, face south, face west, and face north.

source_sentence: 即時東方有三百五十阿羅漢來，南方亦爾，西方亦爾，北方亦爾，合千阿羅漢在佛前。
translation: Immediately, three hundred and fifty arhats came from the east. The same thing happened in the south; the same thing happened in the west; the same thing happened in the north. Altogether one thousand arhats were present before the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛便與千比丘僧俱，到摩訶卑耶和題俱曇彌舍利所，佛便坐，千比丘皆就座。
translation: The Buddha then accompanied a thousand monks and went to Mahāprajāpaṇa Kauṇḍāmiśāriputra's place, where the Buddha was seated, and a thousand monks all took their seats.

source_sentence: 是時，佛便告賢者阿難：「汝起，取摩訶卑耶和題俱曇彌舍利，以鉢盛之，
translation: Then the Buddha said to the venerable Ānanda: rise up, take what you have in your hands and put it into my bowl.” The venerable Ānanda rose up and took Mahāprajāpatīṃśalīputra’s relics.

source_sentence: 持來著我手中。」
translation: Take it and put it in my hand.

source_sentence: 阿難言：「唯然。」
translation: Ānanda said, Yes, it's true.

source_sentence: 便起坐取摩訶卑耶和題俱曇彌舍利，著鉢中持授佛，佛即以兩手受之。
translation: He rose from his seat, took Mahāprajāpatī Kauṇḍāmiśāriputra's relics, put them in his bowl, and handed them to the Buddha, who accepted them with both hands.

source_sentence: 摩訶卑耶和題俱曇彌舍利已受，佛便告眾比丘僧：「是母人聚舍利也，
translation: After receiving the relics of Mahāprajāpaṇa Kauṇḍāmbī, the Buddha then addressed the monks and bhikṣus, saying: “This is a collection of relics belonging to my mother’s family.

source_sentence: 本是惡身急弊卒暴輕心數轉嫉妬，摩訶卑耶和題俱曇彌，已捨母人聚身，
translation: Originally, this was a bad body with an urgent and unwholesome mind that became increasingly jealous. Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī abandoned his mother’s group of bodies in order to reject her.

source_sentence: 男子所應得者摩訶卑耶和題為已得也。」
translation: The man who should attain it is Mahāprajāpaṇeśvara, who has already attained it.

source_sentence: 是時佛令耶游陀迦羅越眾比丘僧，共為摩訶卑耶和題俱曇彌并五百比丘尼起塔，
translation: The Buddha then ordered the monks and nuns of Yaśodharā-Kāra越 to build a stupa together for Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī and five hundred other bhikṣuṇīs.

source_sentence: 已起塔及惟舍利國人民及諸天人，皆共事摩訶卑耶和題俱曇彌并五百比丘尼塔。
translation: The people of Vaiśālī and the gods and goddesses all served Mahāprajāpaṇḍikā and the five hundred bhikṣuṇī stūpas together.

source_sentence: 佛說如是，諸比丘皆歡喜，起前為佛作禮而去。
translation: When the Buddha said this, the monks all rejoiced and got up, paid homage to the Buddha, and departed.
